Articles.Content:
So I was lurking around the forum, when saw the Munbug thread. There is that picture of Kerbal getting ready to strike a golf ball near his lander on the Mun. So I thought "Wouldn't it be fun to do the same in the game? It actually happened on Apollo 14 mission!"

And I don't want the game to become some sort of Mario Golf, but isntead it could provide science points. Also it would be fun to see the ball itself bumping around in Mun's craters. We already have whack a kerbal in debug window, but it's not the same.

So what do you guys think? Is this a stupid idea or would it be fun to you to watch kerbals play golf?

More about golf in space: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alan_Shepard

Munbug thread: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/28073-Accurate-Apollo-Replica-Munbug-X-Saturn-V-CSM-Lander-Buggy-and-A-L-S-E-P

It's a very stupid idea

I love it
just have the model be the antennae with a gravioli science thing on the end. you hit an accelerometer or barometer around.
This would be so fun to do!
